summary: AMONIA LEAK FROM RV FRIDGE (NORCOLD 1200LRIM).  UNIT FAILED TO COOL, UPON CHECIKING COMPARTMENT THERE WAS VISUAL INDICATION OF LEAK AS WELL AS SMELL OF AMONIA.  NORCOLD HAS A HISTORY OF RECALLS/COOLING UNIT FAILURES DUE TO AMONIA LEAK.  CONTACTED THEM 3 TIMES - 2X PHONE, 1XE-MAIL.  BY PHONE (TO THEIR RECALL HOTLINE AS WELL AS TO THEIR CS LINE) WAS TOLD THAT OUR S/N WAS OUTSIDE OF THEIR RECALL RANGE.  NEVER RECEIVED A RESPONSE TO THE E-MAIL.  THERE WAS SLIGHT DAMAGE TO FRIDGE COMPARTMENT AND DRAWERS BENEATH FRIDGE AS WELL AS LOSS OF FOOD.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2006 COUNTRY COACH ALLURE RV.  WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS AT A REPAIR SHOP FOR ROUTINE MAINTENANCE, THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT THE DRY SPLINE ON THE VEHICLE WOULD SOON FAIL.  THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED BEFORE THE FAILURE OCCURRED AT THE COST OF $775.  THE CONTACT CALLED THE MANUFACTURER AND WAS INFORMED THAT NO COMPENSATION WOULD BE PROVIDED BECAUSE THE VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED IN A RECALL.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 43,000 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 43,153.
